gurmukhi: duAwry khXo bYT lCmnw ] pYT n koaU pwvY jnw ] AMqih purih Awp pgu Dwrw ] doih Coir miRq lok isDwrw ]849]
transliteration: Dudare Kahyo Baith Lachhmanaa|| Paith Na Ko( i)  Paavai Janaa|| Antah(i) Purab(i) Aap Pag(u) Dhaaraa|| Deh(i) Chhodh(i) Mrit Lok Sidhaaraa||849||
translation: Ram said to Lakshman, “You sit on the gate and do not let anyone to come in.” Ram himself went into the palace and abandoning his body left this abode of death.849.

gurmukhi: ieMdR mqI ihq Aj niRpq ijm giH qj lIA jog ] iqm rGubr qn ko qjw sRI jwnkI ibXog ]850]
transliteration: Indra Matihit Aj Nripat Jim Grih Leea Joh|| Tim Raghoubar Tan Ko Tajaa Srijaanakibiyog||850||
translation: The way in which the king Aja had accepted Yoga for Indumati and left his home, in the same manner, Ram abandoned his body on having been separated from Sita.850.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk rwmvqwry sIqw ky hyq miRq lok sy gey iDAwie smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Aamavtdare Seetaa Ke Het Mrit Lok Se Gad Dhiaae Samaaptan||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘Forsaking the abode of Death for Sita’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.

gurmukhi: AQ qIno BRwqw qRIAn sihq mrbo kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Teeno Bhraataa Treean Sahit Marbo Kathanan||
translation: The description of the Death of the Three Brothers alongwith their wives :

gurmukhi: raur prI sgry pur mwhI ] kwhUM rhI kCU suD nwhI ] nr nwrI folq duiKAwry ] jwnuk igry jUiJ juiJAwry ]851]
transliteration: Raur Parisagre Pur Maahee|| Kaahoon Rahikachhodh Sudh Naahee|| Nar Naaridolat Doukhidare|| Jaanouk Gire Joojh(i) Jujhidare||851||
translation: There was great tumult in the whole city and none of the residents was in his senses; the men and women staggered like the warriors writhing after falling during fight in the battlefield.851.

gurmukhi: sgr ngr mih pr geI raurw ] bXwkul igry hsq Aru Gorw ] nr nwrI mn rhq audwsw ] khw rwm kr gey qmwsw ]852]
transliteration: Sagad Nagad Maih Par Gadrauraa|| Buaakul Gire Hast Ar(u) Ghoraa|| Nar Naariman Rahat Udaasaa|| Kahaa Raam Kar Gad Tamaasaa||852||
translation: There was uproar throughout the city and the elephants and horses also began to fall, being worried, what type of sport has been played by Ram? Thinking about this thing the men and women remained under depression.852.

gurmukhi: BrQaU jog swDnw swjI ] jog Agn qn qy auprwjI ] bHmrMDR Jt dYkr Porw ] pRB sO clq AMg nhI morw ]853]
transliteration: Bharthaoo Jog Saadhanaa Saajee|| Jog Agad Tan Te Oupraajee|| Brahrandhra Jhat Daikar Phoraa|| Prabh Sau Chalat An Nahimoraa||853||
translation: Bharat also produced Yoga fire in his body by practising Yoga and with a jerk got his Brahmrandhra burst and definitely went towards Ram.853.

gurmukhi: skl jog ky kIey ibDwnw ] lCmn qjy qYs hI pRwnw ] bHmrMDR lv Air Pun PUtw ] pRB crnn qr pRwn inKUtw ]854]
transliteration: Sakal Jog Ke Keee Bidhaanaa|| Lachhman Taje Tais Hipraanaa|| Brahmrandhra Lav Ar(i) Phoun Phootaa|| Prabh Chrnan Tar Praan Nikhntaa||854||
translation: Lakshman alos did this, practicing all types of Yoga he gave up his life. Then the Brahmrandhra of Shatrughan also burst and he breathed his last to be at the feet of the Lord.854.

gurmukhi: lv kus doaU qhwN cl gey ] rGubr sIAih jrwvq Bey ] Ar ipq BRwq iqhUM kh dhw ] rwj CqR lv ky isr rhw ]855]
transliteration: Lav Kous Dooo Tahaan Chal Gad|| Rahghoubar Seeah(i) Jaraavat Bhae|| Ar Pit Bhraat Tihoon Kah Dahaa|| Raaj Chhatra Lav Ke Sir Rahaa||855||
translation: Lava and Kusha both came forward and performed the funeral rites of Ram and Sita; they also performed the funeral rites of the brothers of their father and in this way Lava assumed the royal canopy over his head.855.

gurmukhi: iqhUMAn kI iesqRI iqh AweI ] sMig sqI hÍY surg isDweI ] lv isr Drw rwj kw swjw ] iqhUMAn iqhUM kuMt kIA rwjw ]856]
transliteration: Tihoonan Kiikstritih Aaee|| San(i) Saihvai Surag Sidhaaee|| Lav Sir Dharaa Raaj Kaa Saajaa|| Tihoonan Tihoon Kount Keea Raajaa||856||
translation: The wives of the three brothers came there and they also became Satis and left for the heavenly abode. Lava assumed the kingship and made the three (cousins) the kings of three directions.856.
